Zend_Http  
Client_Adapter  
No 
No 

Description

A sockets based (stream_socket_client) adapter class for Zend_Http_Client. Can be used on almost every PHP environment, and does not require any special extensions.

Methods

__construct, __destruct, _checkSocketReadTimeout, close, connect, getConfig, getStreamContext, read, setConfig, setOutputStream, setStreamContext, write,

__construct( ) : n/a

Description

Adapter constructor, currently empty. Config is set using setConfig()

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

__destruct( ) : n/a

Description

Destructor: make sure the socket is disconnected

If we are in persistent TCP mode, will not close the connection


Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

_checkSocketReadTimeout( ) : n/a

Description

Check if the socket has timed out - if so close connection and throw an exception

Return value

Type Description
n/a n/a

Tags

Name Description
throws Zend_Http_Client_Adapter_Exception with READ_TIMEOUT code

getStreamContext( ) : resource

Description

Get the stream context for the TCP connection to the server.

If no stream context is set, will create a default one.


Return value

Type Description
resource

Description

Read response from server

Return value

Zend_Http_Client_Adapter_Socket

setStreamContext( mixed   $context, ) : Zend_Http_Client_Adapter_Socket

Description

Set the stream context for the TCP connection to the server

Can accept either a pre-existing stream context resource, or an array of stream options, similar to the options array passed to the stream_context_create() PHP function. In such case a new stream context will be created using the passed options.


Arguments

Name Type Description Default
$context mixed | Stream context or array of context options

Return value

Type Description
Zend_Http_Client_Adapter_Socket

Tags

Name Description
since Zend Framework 1.9
